definitions: systematic process of predicting future events or conditions based on data analysis
specialized meteorological practice of predicting atmospheric conditions for specific locations
examples: Economic forecasting helps businesses prepare for market changes ahead
The company relies on sales forecasting to manage inventory levels
Weather forecasting predicted heavy rainfall throughout the weekend ahead
Modern forecasting uses satellite data to track storm systems accurately

definitions: raised deck at the forward part of a ship where crew quarters were traditionally located
examples: The sailors gathered on the forecastle to watch dolphins ahead
Heavy waves crashed over the forecastle during the Atlantic storm

definitions: legal process where a lender takes ownership of property due to borrower's failure to make mortgage payments
examples: The bank initiated foreclosure after six months of missed payments
Rising interest rates led to increased foreclosure rates nationwide recently

definitions: open paved area in front of a building, especially a gas station or large public building
examples: Cars lined up in the petrol station forecourt during rush hour
The palace forecourt provided space for ceremonial military parades annually

definitions: male ancestor from earlier generations, especially one who helped establish a family, nation, or tradition
examples: Our forefathers fought bravely for this country's independence centuries ago
He traced his family lineage back to forefathers in Scotland

definitions: most prominent or important position in a particular area, movement, or field of activity
examples: The company remains at the forefront of renewable energy technology
She positioned herself at the forefront of social justice movements

definitions: part of a view or picture that appears nearest to the observer
position of prominence or importance in awareness or consideration
examples: The artist painted flowers in the foreground of the landscape
Mountains appeared hazy behind the sharply focused foreground trees
The report brings environmental concerns into the foreground decisively
User experience should remain in the foreground during software development

definitions: tennis stroke made with the palm of the hand facing the direction of the shot
examples: Her powerful forehand dominated the match from baseline positions consistently
He practiced his forehand grip with the tennis coach daily

definitions: part of the face above the eyebrows extending to the hairline
examples: Sweat dripped from his forehead during the intense workout session
She placed a cool compress on the child's fevered forehead

definitions: person from a country other than one's own or the one being discussed
examples: Many foreigners visit the city during the summer tourist season
The company hired several foreigners for their international expertise recently

definitions: awareness or understanding of something before it happens or exists through prediction or special information
examples: His foreknowledge of market trends gave him significant investment advantages
The prophet claimed foreknowledge of future disasters through divine revelation

definitions: piece of land that projects into water, especially a cape or promontory
examples: The lighthouse stood prominently on the rocky foreland overlooking the sea
Ships navigated carefully around the dangerous foreland during storms nightly

definitions: either of the two front legs of a four-legged animal
examples: The horse injured its right foreleg jumping over the fence
The veterinarian examined both forelegs for signs of lameness carefully

definitions: front limb or appendage of an animal, including arms, wings, or flippers
examples: The bat's forelimbs evolved into wings over millions of years
Whales use their forelimbs as flippers for swimming through oceans

definitions: worker who supervises and directs other workers in a factory or construction site
person selected to lead and speak for a jury during deliberations
examples: The construction foreman assigned daily tasks to all crew members
She worked as foreman at the manufacturing plant for decades
The jury foreman announced the unanimous verdict to the court
After deliberation, they elected Sarah as foreman of the jury

definitions: mast nearest the bow on a ship with two or more masts
examples: The sail on the foremast caught wind first as they left harbor
Lightning struck the foremast during the violent storm at sea

definitions: person's first name, as distinguished from their surname or family name
examples: Please write your forename followed by your surname on the form
His forename was James, though everyone called him Jimmy casually

definitions: person or thing that precedes and influences the development of someone or something else
sign or warning of something that will happen in the future
examples: The steam engine was a forerunner of modern transportation systems
These scientists were forerunners in the field of genetic research
Dark clouds are often forerunners of approaching thunderstorms ahead
Economic indicators serve as forerunners of market trends emerging soon

definitions: literary device giving advance hint or warning of what is to come later in a story
examples: The author's foreshadowing made the plot twist feel inevitable naturally
Dark imagery provided foreshadowing of the tragic ending approaching slowly

definitions: part of a shore between high and low water marks, exposed at low tide
examples: Children searched for shells along the foreshore during low tide
The foreshore revealed hidden rock pools teeming with marine life

definitions: ability to predict what will happen and prepare for it through careful thought and planning
examples: His foresight in saving money helped during the economic downturn
Urban planners showed remarkable foresight in preserving green spaces downtown

definitions: retractable fold of skin covering the glans of the penis in uncircumcised males
examples: The doctor explained proper hygiene care for the infant's foreskin
Medical conditions sometimes require surgical removal of the foreskin later

definitions: large area covered chiefly with trees and undergrowth, forming a complex ecosystem
examples: The ancient forest stretched for hundreds of miles beyond the valley
Wildlife thrives in the protected forest reserve near our town

definitions: person trained in forestry who manages, develops, and protects forest resources professionally
examples: The forester marked trees for selective harvesting this autumn season
She worked as a forester protecting endangered woodland habitats nationwide

definitions: science and practice of managing forests for timber production, conservation, and ecological sustainability
examples: He studied forestry at university to become a conservation specialist
Sustainable forestry practices help maintain biodiversity while harvesting timber resources

definitions: either of the two front wings of a four-winged insect like a butterfly or dragonfly
examples: The butterfly's colorful forewings displayed intricate patterns for mating displays
Damage to the forewing prevented the moth from flying properly

definitions: short introduction to a book, typically written by someone other than the author
examples: The celebrity wrote a touching foreword praising the author's work
Publishers often request forewords from experts to enhance book credibility

definitions: something that is lost or given up as punishment or consequence of wrongdoing
item or right that is confiscated or surrendered due to breach of rules
examples: Players must pay a forfeit when they break game rules
The team accepted the forfeit rather than continuing without key players
His driver's license became forfeit after multiple traffic violations occurred
The seized property was forfeit to the state after conviction

definitions: act of losing or surrendering something as punishment for wrongdoing or breach of contract
examples: Asset forfeiture laws allow police to seize criminal proceeds permanently
The contract included forfeiture clauses for missed deadline penalties automatically

definitions: workshop with furnace where metal is heated and shaped by hammering
act of producing fraudulent copies of documents, signatures, or valuable items
examples: The blacksmith worked at his forge creating horseshoes all day
Sparks flew from the forge as metal was hammered into shape
Police discovered a forge operation producing counterfeit currency downtown recently
The art forge created fake paintings sold to unsuspecting collectors

definitions: person who illegally makes or imitates documents, signatures, banknotes, or works of art
examples: The skilled forger replicated famous paintings for decades before capture
Police arrested the forger who created fake passports for criminals

definitions: crime of illegally copying documents, signatures, or valuable items to deceive
fake document or artwork created to pass as genuine original
examples: He was convicted of forgery after signing someone else's name
The bank detected the check forgery through signature analysis systems
Experts identified the painting as a clever forgery worth nothing
The museum unknowingly displayed several forgeries for years before discovery

definitions: process of shaping metal by heating and hammering in a forge
act of creating or developing something through sustained effort and determination
examples: The forging process strengthens steel through repeated heating and hammering
Traditional sword forging requires years of training to master properly
Nations are forging new alliances in response to global challenges
The team succeeded in forging consensus despite initial disagreements strongly

definitions: implement with two or more prongs used for eating or serving food
point where something divides into two or more branches or parts
agricultural or gardening tool with prongs for lifting or digging
examples: She picked up her fork to eat the pasta dinner
The silver fork gleamed on the elegant table setting beautifully
Take the left fork when the road splits ahead tomorrow
The river fork created two separate waterways flowing in different directions
He used a pitchfork to move hay into the barn
The garden fork helped turn over soil for spring planting

definitions: process or point where something divides into two or more separate branches or paths
examples: The forking of the trail confused hikers without proper maps
Code forking created two separate versions of the software project

definitions: powered industrial truck with pronged platform for lifting and transporting heavy materials
examples: The warehouse worker operated the forklift to move pallets efficiently
Safety certification is required before operating any forklift equipment here

definitions: visible shape or configuration of something physical
printed document with blank spaces for information to be inserted
particular way in which something exists or appears as a type or variety
examples: The sculpture's form emerged gradually from the marble block carefully
Clouds took on strange forms as the storm approached slowly
Please complete this application form with your personal details accurately
Tax forms must be submitted before the April deadline annually
This rare form of cancer requires specialized treatment protocols immediately
Democracy takes many different forms around the world today historically

definitions: formal clothing or dress worn for special occasions requiring elegant attire like evening gowns or tuxedos
examples: She bought a new formal for the charity gala next month
The shop specializes in formals for proms and wedding celebrations

definitions: colorless pungent gas in solution used as disinfectant and preservative for biological specimens
examples: The laboratory stored specimens in formaldehyde solution for preservation purposes
Formaldehyde exposure requires proper ventilation and safety equipment always necessary

definitions: excessive adherence to prescribed forms, rules, or ceremonies without regard to content
artistic or literary theory emphasizing form and technique over content and meaning
examples: Bureaucratic formalism often hinders efficient problem solving in organizations today
The judge criticized the lawyer's formalism over substantive legal arguments
Russian formalism influenced literary criticism throughout the twentieth century significantly
The artist rejected formalism in favor of emotional expression freely

definitions: thing that is done as a matter of requirement or custom without real significance
rigid observance of rules, conventions, or ceremony in behavior or procedure
examples: The interview was just a formality since they'd already decided
Signing these papers is merely a formality to complete registration
The wedding maintained all traditional formalities despite the small guest list
Business formality requires proper dress code during client meetings always

definitions: process of making something official, systematic, or organized according to established rules or procedures
examples: The formalization of company policies took several months to complete
Mathematical formalization helps clarify complex theoretical concepts more precisely overall

definitions: way in which something is arranged, designed, or presented visually or structurally
specific arrangement of data for storage, display, or processing in computing
examples: The magazine changed its format to appeal to younger readers
The conference format includes keynote speeches and breakout sessions daily
Save the document in PDF format for easier sharing online
This video format isn't compatible with older media players unfortunately

definitions: process of developing or creating something over time through natural or deliberate means
particular arrangement or pattern of people, things, or elements organized for a purpose
distinctive geological feature created by natural processes over extended time periods
examples: The formation of new habits requires consistent practice over weeks
Cloud formation indicated changing weather patterns approaching from the west
The birds flew in perfect V formation during their migration
Military formation training teaches disciplined group movement and coordination skills
The rock formation revealed millions of years of geological history
Limestone formations created spectacular caves throughout the mountain region slowly

definitions: process of arranging or configuring text, data, or media according to specific style requirements
examples: Document formatting includes adjusting fonts, margins, and spacing appropriately throughout
The formatting process ensures consistency across all company reports annually

definitions: mathematical relationship or rule expressed in symbols showing how to calculate something
list of ingredients and proportions for making something, especially in chemistry or cooking
prepared milk substitute for feeding babies who are not breastfed
examples: The quadratic formula solves second-degree polynomial equations systematically always
Einstein's formula E=mcÂ² revolutionized physics understanding of energy relationships
The secret formula for the soft drink remains closely guarded
Scientists developed a new formula for stronger adhesive compounds recently
The pediatrician recommended switching to a different baby formula
Parents need to prepare formula according to package instructions carefully

definitions: official list of medicines approved for prescription in a healthcare system
book or document containing set forms of words or formulas for use
examples: The hospital formulary determines which medications doctors can prescribe routinely
Insurance companies maintain formularies listing covered prescription drugs specifically detailed
The medieval formulary contained standard legal document templates for clerks
Religious formularies provided prescribed prayers for various ceremonial occasions historically

definitions: process of creating or preparing something carefully according to a plan or formula
particular mixture of ingredients prepared according to a specific formula
examples: The formulation of new policies required extensive stakeholder consultation first
Careful formulation of the research question determines study success ultimately
This sunscreen formulation provides broad-spectrum UV protection all day
The new drug formulation reduces side effects significantly for patients

definitions: consensual sexual intercourse between people not married to each other, especially viewed as morally wrong
examples: Religious texts often condemn fornication as sinful behavior requiring repentance
Historical laws against fornication reflected societal moral standards of earlier eras

definitions: fortified building or strategic position used for military defense against enemy attacks
examples: The ancient fort overlooked the valley protecting trade routes below
Soldiers defended the fort against repeated attacks for months continuously
